meanings.definition: The quality or state of being linear.
meanings.sent1: The linearities of the design made it easy to follow.
meanings.sent2: The teacher explained the concept of linearities in a clear and simple way.
meanings.sent3: The linearities of the road were so perfect that it almost seemed unreal.

meanings.definition: The property of a mathematical function that can be graphed as a straight line.
meanings.sent1: Understanding the linearities of the graph made it easier to analyze the data.
meanings.sent2: In math class, they learned about the linearities of different functions.
meanings.sent3: The linearities of the graph were so clear that even a child could understand.
meanings.sent4: The linearities of the function revealed a simple pattern in the data.

meanings.definition: The quality of being arranged in a straight line or in a linear fashion.

meanings.sent2: The linearities of the rows of chairs made the room look neat and organized.
meanings.sent3: The linearities of the traffic cones created a funny maze on the road.
